main event: The report documents an unidentified flying object sighting near George AFB, California, on 18th August 1952. The object was described as round, bright, and shiny, with no exhaust or sound, and appeared to be hovering or moving very slowly before suddenly accelerating and disappearing. Multiple observers from the Air Force and a flying club noticed the object over a period of 4-5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed to be larger than large airplanes and exhibited considerable brightness, reflecting sunlight, and could not have been a balloon or aircraft.
Experienced pilots and officers, including Colonel Amos F. Bixby and Captain Daniel W. Reeves, observed the object using binoculars and were unable to identify it.
The object was sighted both on 11th and 13th August 1952, with no physical evidence or explanation for the sightings.
The weather at the time of the sighting was clear and calm, with no meteorological conditions to account for the unidentified object.
An attempt to intercept the object by sending a F-86 flight to its last sighted location was unsuccessful, indicating the high speed and unpredictable movement of the object.
sighted object: single round, bright, and shiny object
witnesses: multiple Air Force officers and members of a flying club
photographs: no photographs included in the report
